data.stimulus:
Let's start with some VOCABULARY.

► Below are 12 sentences with words or phrases from the text (in red). 

  • Read the complete sentences carefully to understand the context.
  • The aim of this activity is to practise using the context to understand vocabulary.
  • Do not use your dictionary.

► Match each word with its meaning.
data.template:
• 1. If you leave fish out of the fridge for 24 hours, it will start to decompose. {{response}}
  • 2. There are many types of sustainable energy. One of them is natural gas.  {{response}}
  • 3. Some countries have set up initiatives to produce renewable energy. {{response}}
  • 4. Fossil fuels pollute the environment. {{response}}
  • 5.A wind turbine is a machine that uses wind pressure to generate power. {{response}}
  • 6. The correct way to dispose of an old sofa if to find a place where it can be recycled. {{response}}

value: difficult to say which should come first
similar to a very large oven

possible_responses: difficult to say which should come first
similar to a very large oven
data.template:
• 7. Biomass is used as a fuel which converts organic matter into energy. {{response}}
  • 8. Businesses are often given subsidies to encourage them to do more ethical things. {{response}}
  • 9. You need experience to get a job but you cannot get a job without experience: it’s a ‘chicken-and-egg’ situation. {{response}}
  • 10. The impact of fossil fuels on the environment has been considerable. {{response}}
  • 11.  The more fossil fuels we incinerate the more we damage the environment. {{response}}
  • 12. In Kristianstad there are furnaces to burn organic matter to generate power. {{response}}

value: difficult to say which should come first
similar to a very large oven

Now review the text and find the sentences below.

► Decide if they are main or supporting ideas.

 

Remember: you should read the part of text immediately before and after each sentence in order to understand the context of the sentence.
data.template:
• Natural gas and biogas are polluting when burned, but much less than coal and oil. (lines 1–3) {{response}}
  • The policy director of the Wisconsin group describes biomass as an ‘opportunity fuel’. (lines 17–19) {{response}}
  • Both old fossil fuel technologies and a modern biomass replacement exist in Kristianstad. (lines 29–31) {{response}}
  • Tanker trucks are now being used for delivering wood pellets. (lines 31–35) {{response}}
  • New York also uses a district heating system. (lines 69–72) {{response}}
  • Kristianstad no longer uses fossil fuels and is now making use of other sources of energy. (lines 92–94) {{response}}

options.label: Summer is a wonderful time at West Beach.
West beach is especially suitable for children and surfing.
West Beach is suitable for people of all ages.

data.stimulus:
In the next exercises, you will continue to practise identifying main ideas.

► Read each paragraph below and decide which sentence summarises its main idea.

 

 

 

Paragraph 1 

Summer is a wonderful time to spend at West Beach. It is a beach with light-colored, soft sand. The coastline goes on for a long way and many people enjoy walking along it. Children like to play in the surf and walk along the rocks that are visible at low tide. This is a fun beach for people of all ages.

options.label: Apollo 13 was a very successful movie.
Apollo 13 is based on a true story.

data.stimulus:
Paragraph 2 

The movie Apollo 13 was a blockbuster for the summer of 1995. It is an exciting story about space exploration. In the movie, the astronauts get in trouble while they are trying to return to Earth. People in the audience are on the edge of their seats waiting to see what happens. What makes it even more exciting is that it is a true story.

options.label: Teenagers and young adults are very indecisive.
Things you can do to help you choose a career.
It's difficult to choose a career.

data.stimulus:
Paragraph 3 

Most teenagers and young adults do not know what they want to do for the rest of their lives. It is a big decision. There are a number of things you can do to narrow the choices. For example you can take an interest test, do some research on your own about a career, try volunteer work in the field in which you are interested, or “job-shadow”, in which you spend a day with a person who is working in a field that interests you. These are just a few helpful ideas as you begin to choose a career.

options.label: McDonald’s has outlets all around the world
McDonald’s is the leader of the fast food market.

data.stimulus:
Paragraph 4 

The United States seems to be in love with the idea of going out to eat. Because of this, a real variety of restaurants has come about specializing in all kinds of foods. McDonald’s is the king of a subgroup of restaurants called fast-food restaurants. Chances are, no matter where you live, there is a McDonald’s restaurant near you. There are even McDonald’s in the Soviet Union. Now McDonald’s is trying something new. It is called McDonald’s Express and there is a test site in Peabody, Massachusetts. It is part of a Mobil gas station. This allows you to fill up with gas and fill up on food at the same time. What will they think of next?
